alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:09PM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THURSDAY TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY FOR THE WESTERN CAPES... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Northeast winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Capes, including Platinum and Goodnews Bay. * WHEN...From 9 PM Thursday to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will lead to white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...On Thursday afternoon, strong northeasterly winds will begin to increase over the Bristol Bay coast. Snow will begin Thursday evening along the coast and then spread inland through Friday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
